title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement [INSERT CONTACT METHOD]. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/ code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https:// www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to tsdbr
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to tsdbr
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to tsdbr
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("", fork = TRUE). Install development dependences devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. Begin commit merge messages - indicate user facing changes included NEWS.md. use fledge automatically generate NEWS.md file.

title: Contributing to tsdbr
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to tsdbr
text: Please note tsdbr project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Getting help with tsdbr
text: Thanks using tsdbr! filing issue, places explore pieces put together make process smooth possible.

title: Getting help with tsdbr
text: opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn’t reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers (e.g. :pr, :closed) needed. example, ’d simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed.

title: Getting help with tsdbr
text: Start making minimal reproducible example using reprex package. haven’t heard used reprex , ’re treat! Seriously, reprex make R-question-asking endeavors easier (pretty insane ROI five ten minutes ’ll take learn ’s ). additional reprex pointers, check Get help! section tidyverse site.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Thorley J (2025). tsdbr: Environmental Time Series Databasing. R package version 0.0.0.9021.
code: @Manual{,   title = {tsdbr: Environmental Time Series Databasing},   author = {Joe Thorley},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9021}, }

title: Environmental Time Series Databasing
text: tsdbr designed create, populate, maintain query SQLite databases environmental time series data.

title: Environmental Time Series Databasing
code: library(tsdbr) conn <- ts_create_db(":memory:") options(tsdbr.conn = conn) ts_add_parameter("discharge", "cms") ts_add_site("Niagara Falls") ts_add_station("S1", "discharge", "Niagara Falls", "hour") data <- data.frame(   Station = "S1", DateTime = ISOdate(2000, 9, 1, 0:23),   Recorded = 0:23 - 2,   stringsAsFactors = FALSE ) ts_add_data(data) data <- ts_get_data(   start_date = as.Date("2000-09-01"),   end_date = as.Date("2000-09-02") ) print(head(data)) #> # A tibble: 6 × 11 #>   Station DateTime            Recorded Corrected Status     Site    Depth Parameter Units StationName Comments #>   <chr>   <dttm>                 <dbl>     <dbl> <ord>      <chr>   <dbl> <chr>     <chr> <chr>       <chr>    #> 1 S1      2000-09-01 00:00:00       -2        -2 reasonable Niagar…    NA discharge cms   <NA>        <NA>     #> 2 S1      2000-09-01 01:00:00       -1        -1 reasonable Niagar…    NA discharge cms   <NA>        <NA>     #> 3 S1      2000-09-01 02:00:00        0         0 reasonable Niagar…    NA discharge cms   <NA>        <NA>     #> 4 S1      2000-09-01 03:00:00        1         1 reasonable Niagar…    NA discharge cms   <NA>        <NA>     #> 5 S1      2000-09-01 04:00:00        2         2 reasonable Niagar…    NA discharge cms   <NA>        <NA>     #> 6 S1      2000-09-01 05:00:00        3         3 reasonable Niagar…    NA discharge cms   <NA>        <NA> ts_plot_data(data) ts_disconnect_db()

title: Environmental Time Series Databasing
text: Please report issues. Pull requests always welcome.

title: Environmental Time Series Databasing
text: Please note tsdbr project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: Add Data — ts_add_data
code: ts_add_data(   data,   aggregate = NULL,   na_rm = FALSE,   resolution = "abort",   conn = getOption("tsdbr.conn", NULL) )

title: Add Data — ts_add_data
text: data data frame data columns Station, DateTime, Recorded. Additional optional columns include Corrected, Status, Comments. aggregate function aggregate multiple values within station period. na_rm flag indicating whether remove missing values (possible) aggregating. resolution string action take regard existing values. Options 'abort', 'ignore' 'replace'. conn object class SQLiteConnection.

title: Add Parameter — ts_add_parameter
text: parameter string parameter name. units string units conn object class SQLiteConnection.

title: Add Parameters — ts_add_parameters
text: parameters data frame parameters columns Parameter Units. conn object class SQLiteConnection.

title: Add Sites — ts_add_site
code: ts_add_site(   site,   longitude = NA_real_,   latitude = NA_real_,   organization = NA_character_,   site_name = NA_character_,   comments = NA_character_,   conn = getOption("tsdbr.conn", NULL) )

title: Add Sites — ts_add_site
text: site string site name. longitude numeric site longitude. latitude numeric site latitude. organization string organization name. site_name string site name. comments string site comments. conn object class SQLiteConnection.

title: Add Site — ts_add_sites
text: sites data frame parameters columns Site. optional columns Longitude, Latitude, Organization, SiteName Comments. conn object class SQLiteConnection.

title: Add Station — ts_add_station
code: ts_add_station(   station,   parameter,   site,   period,   lower_limit = NA_real_,   upper_limit = NA_real_,   depth = NA_real_,   station_name = NA_character_,   station_id = NA_character_,   comments = NA_character_,   conn = getOption("tsdbr.conn", NULL) )

title: Add Station — ts_add_station
text: station string station. parameter string parameter. site string site. period string period. possible values 'year', 'month', 'day', 'hour', 'minute' 'second'. lower_limit numeric lower limit. upper_limit numeric upper limit. depth numeric depth. station_name string station name. station_id string station id. comments string station comments. conn object class SQLiteConnection.

title: Add Stations — ts_add_stations
text: stations data frame stations columns Station, Parameter, Site Period. optional columns Depth, LowerLimit, UpperLimit, StationName, StationID Comments. conn object class SQLiteConnection.

title: Create Time-Series Database — ts_create_db
text: Creates empty SQLite database store time series data. UTC offset Alaska -8.

title: Create Time-Series Database — ts_create_db
text: file string name database file. utc_offset integer utc offset must lie -12 14. periods character vector permitted periods. Possible values 'year', 'month', 'day', 'hour', 'minute', 'second'

title: Delete Station — ts_delete_station
text: station string station name. conn object class SQLiteConnection.

title: Doctor Database — ts_doctor_db
code: ts_doctor_db(   check_limits = TRUE,   check_period = FALSE,   check_gaps = FALSE,   fix = FALSE,   conn = getOption("tsdbr.conn", NULL) )

title: Doctor Database — ts_doctor_db
text: check_limits flag indicating whether check corrected values outside lower upper limits coded erroneous. check_period flag indicating whether check periods valid. check_gaps flag indicating whether check gaps data given period. fix flag indicating whether fix problems conn object class SQLiteConnection.

title: Doctor Database — ts_doctor_db
text: flag indicating whether database passed checks (fixed)

title: Get Data — ts_get_data
code: ts_get_data(   stations = NULL,   start_date = NULL,   end_date = NULL,   period = "hour",   na_rm = FALSE,   status = "questionable",   fill = TRUE,   conn = getOption("tsdbr.conn", NULL) )

title: Get Data — ts_get_data
text: stations character vector stations. start_date start date. end_date end date. period string period aggregate average . possible values 'year', 'month', 'day', 'hour', 'minute' 'second'. na_rm flag indicating whether remove missing values (possible) aggregating. status string worse type data get. possible values 'reasonable', 'questionable' 'erroneous'. fill flag indicating whether fill gaps (missing values). conn object class SQLiteConnection.

title: Get Stations Table — ts_get_stations
code: ts_get_stations(   parameters = NULL,   periods = c("year", "month", "day", "hour", "minute", "second"),   sites = NULL,   conn = getOption("tsdbr.conn", NULL) )

title: Get Stations Table — ts_get_stations
text: parameters character parameters filter . periods character vector periods filter . sites character sites filter . conn object class SQLiteConnection.

title: Get Table — ts_get_table
text: table string table get. conn object class SQLiteConnection.

title: Status to Integer — ts_integer_to_status
text: Converts integer vector ordered factor status values.

title: Status to Integer — ts_integer_to_status
code: ts_integer_to_status(1:3) #> [1] reasonable   questionable erroneous    #> Levels: reasonable < questionable < erroneous

title: Plot Data — ts_plot_data
text: data data frame data plot minimum columns Station, DateTime Recorded /Corrected.

title: Set Disclaimer — ts_set_disclaimer
code: ts_set_disclaimer(   disclaimer = "THE DATA ARE COPYRIGHTED",   conn = getOption("tsdbr.conn", NULL) )

title: Set Disclaimer — ts_set_disclaimer
text: disclaimer string disclaimer. conn object class SQLiteConnection.

title: Set Maintainer — ts_set_maintainer
code: ts_set_maintainer(   maintainer = ts_sys_user(),   conn = getOption("tsdbr.conn", NULL) )

title: Set Maintainer — ts_set_maintainer
text: maintainer string maintainer. conn object class SQLiteConnection.

title: Status to Integer — ts_status_to_integer
text: Converts ordered factor status values integer vector.

title: Translate Stations — ts_translate_stations
text: Translate stations codings Station, StationName StationID. useful data provided different station codings main ones used database.

title: Translate Stations — ts_translate_stations
code: ts_translate_stations(   data,   from = "StationID",   to = "Station",   na_rm = TRUE,   conn = getOption("tsdbr.conn", NULL) )

title: Translate Stations — ts_translate_stations
text: data data frame column Station station coding. string indicating coding translate . Possible values 'Station', 'StationName' 'StationID'. string indicating coding translate . na_rm flag indicating whether remove missing stations. Possible values 'Station', 'StationName' 'StationID'. conn object class SQLiteConnection.

what: UTC Offset to Time Zone — ts_utc_offset_to_tz
title: UTC Offset to Time Zone — ts_utc_offset_to_tz
UTC Offset to Time Zone — ts_utc_offset_to_tz
UTC Offset to Time Zone — ts_utc_offset_to_tz
UTC Offset to Time Zone — ts_utc_offset_to_tz
UTC Offset to Time Zone — ts_utc_offset_to_tz
Write csv — ts_write_csv
text: data data frame minimum columnms Station DateTime file either character string naming file connection     open writing.  "" indicates output console.
